long_desc.thetext:
This message:
>>> Collapsing parts by collapse order... - Warning: Circular dependencies between packages: #15870 - #16382 - Warning: Circular dependencies between packages: #15870 - #16382
Does not give much information! I suppose it is the code line number of the total generated package, but it is not understandable.
Is it possible to print the part and package names for clarity?
Thanks for the report. How much work would that be Thomas? I think that could really help in that case.

I don't think it's worth the effort of a separate bug. This still relates to the experimental part of parts, the message is just a break-out to emit *something*. It will be modified when addressing the underlying issue of intermediate inconsistent states during part collapsing which is addressed in the (meanwhile well-known) bug#4576. As long as the part verifier is satisfied at the end, the OP should just ignore it.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 4576 ***
